covid_data_handler module

This module is responsible for dealing with the covid api requests and covid update scheduling

covid_data_handler.covid_API_request(location: str = 'Exeter', location_type: str = 'ltla') → dict

Used to query the covid19 api and to return results for the relevant area

location: str

The location for which the user wishes to find covid data for. This is automatically set to Exeter

location_type: str

The sort of location that the user is looking for (is it a county, a country, etc)

api.get_json(): dict

Returns a dictionary with the covid api data

covid_data_handler.parse_csv_data(csv_filename: str) → list

Takes a csv file and puts the data in a list of strings so that they can be processed later

csv_filenamestr

The name of the file to be open and read from

data: list

The resulting list of strings

covid_data_handler.process_api_data(location: str = 'Exter', location_type: str = 'ltla') → None

Calls the funtion covid_API_request and then processes the api data to product the data to be displayed on the dashboard

location: str

The location for which the user wishes to find covid data for. This is automatically set to Exeter

location_type: str

The sort of location that the user is looking for (is it a county, a country, etc)

last_7_day_cases: int

The number of new cases in the past 7 days

current_hospital_cases: int

The number of people currently in hospital due to covid

total_deaths: int

The total number of cumulative deaths from covid

covid_data_handler.process_covid_csv_data(covid_csv_data: list) → tuple

Takes a list of strings (intended to be the result from the fuction parse_csv_data) and calculates and returns the the number of new cases in the last 7 days, the current number of people in hospital and the total cumulative number of deaths

covid_csv_data: list

A list of strings (as produced by the function parse_csv_data)

last_7_day_cases: int

The number of new cases in the past 7 days

current_hospital_cases: int

The number of people currently in hospital due to covid

total_deaths: int

The total number of cumulative deaths from covid

covid_data_handler.return_covid_data(location_type: str) → list

Returns the local or national covid data depending on the input

location_type: str

Which sort of data should be returned (local/nation)

local_covid_data: list

A list with the local covid data

national_covid_data: list

A list with the national covid data

covid_data_handler.schedule_covid_updates(update_interval: int, update_name: str) → dict

Schedules a new covid data update for both the local and national data

update_interval: int

The time until the scheduler should update the covid data

update_name: str

The name of the update that has caused the scheduling of the covid data update

a key-value pair: dict

Returns a dictionary with the key being the update name and the value being a list containing both the local and national scheduler objects
